entry.title: Ukraine Accuses Russia of Digging Mass Graves for Civilian Victims
entry.content: Ukrainian officials accused Russia of burying thousands of civilians in mass graves outside Mariupol, as Moscow pressed its offensive to capture the rest of the eastern Donbas region.

entry.title: In Obliterated Kharkiv, Ukrainian Survivors Struggle to Hold Out
entry.content: Parts of what was a sophisticated hub of Ukraine’s science and research now lack basic amenities like running water and electricity. Some 2,000 high-rises have been destroyed, according to the municipality.

entry.title: Marine Le Pen's Far-Right French Party to Pay Nearly $13 Million to Russian Military Contractor
entry.content: The party, named National Rally, is paying the money to a contractor that is currently under U.S. sanctions, part of a settlement involving a previous loan from a Russian bank.

entry.title: New Details of Shanghai Nursing Home Covid Deaths Suggest City Is Overwhelmed
entry.content: China’s policy of lockdowns, coupled with low vaccination rates among older people, hasn’t been effective during the highly contagious Omicron wave. “Every hospital is now a mess.”

entry.title: Macron vs. Le Pen: Growing Voter Discontent Shakes France's Political Foundations
entry.content: Voter malaise, fueled by widening economic disparity, has pushed up support for candidates on the far right and far left in election after election. “Our society is broken.”
